text: Folks - wanted to learn how to use workflow or automation things on HS...can anyone help me here?
Start from HS training, pick the workflow videos from there
I would suggest you have the workflow which will clear the property on the event of the submission.
Does the language switcher module not work on blog templates? Ours is displaying site-wide fine, but missing on the blog page :thinking_face:
i guess so. annoying to have to go two places for content entry..

Hey Ryan, it is not currently a feature of the HubSpot blog. You can upvote the idea here (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Multi-language-Blog/idi-p/10903?_ga=2.43490789.1916049065.1556541985-1049905637.1553527873>) and there is a good write up on a workaround for this here (<https://blog.HubSpot.com/customers/removing-language-barrier-multi-language-module-HubSpot-blogs>) if you're interested in learning about that.
Cheers <@U26AKMZ19> :thumbsup:

Omg. I'm sad I wasn't part of this conversation. How do you separate the two into different generated groups based on tags alone?! I use Mixitup for the filtering.... but can't do both dropdowns as being dynamically generated by tags. Hm.

not familiar with mixitup.

but the generating the dropdowns is actually the easy part. the hard part is handling if the user selects an option in both fields.

for generating the dropdowns you prefix the tag/topic and visually strip out the prefix when looping through the tags.
yeah, i havent tackled having user select both options, yet
Mixitup by Kunka Labs provides a multi-filter option
pretty cool

awesome

ha

Is there a way to prevent HubSpot form submissions? Based on user input I’m doing an ajax call and want to add the return to a hidden field..
<@U2T1S81EX> try that, but with your form embed information of course :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U7AU6414J> hey thanks! I’ve been using this approach on embedded forms but I’m looking for a solution that can be used on non-embedded forms :confused:
<@U2T1S81EX> using a form module you mean?
<@U7AU6414J> yep
Does anyone know if there is a HubSpot marketing channel?
This slack is intended for developers I’m not aware of a HS slack aimed at marketers.
That is what I was thinking. One of my coworkers was asking. Thanks
<@U22PKFRU5>
hey HubSpot dev's this has been like this for a while now...looks like it could be a simple translation fix.

Yup, this is 100% for coders. If you don't code, this is not the right place to be :slightly_smiling_face:

They've tried a few slacks and FB groups for marketers and agencies, never took off with those groups. HubSpot agency partner team does have a pretty good FB group going tho.

The place for non-technical folks to get help and collab is <https://community.HubSpot.com/> <@UBV0Z50DA>
(there's also an area for technical folks too: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers>)
cc <@UBFA10FMF>

Custom module simple menu field UI
<@U22PKFRU5> Thanks. They are trying to figure out if they can have the original source of a contact blank.

> "original source of a contact blank."
I don't understand - can you plz explain?
You can’t, it always has to have some value, the most common will be Offline and Direct depending the source
Currently they have a contact with an original source as offline because it was entered in salesforce and want to change it to having no value
<@UFBNA9K9A> Thanks!
You can change it to a different value however <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/HubSpot-sources-frequently-asked-questions#change-original-source>

<@U2T1S81EX> With the module, you could use the `export_to_template_context = true` that way people still have access to the module interface, but then use the form embed code above, then just add in a target to specify the place you need it on the page.

But when you do it that way all parameters configured on the module level need to be put into the javascript to carry over.

So something like:

```
{% form "myForm" label="ModuleName", form_to_use='444-ddd-555-eee', title='Form Title', export_to_template_context=True %}	

<div class="targetDiv"></div>

hbspt.forms.create({ 
	css: '',
	portalId: 'XXXXX',
	target: '#targetDiv',
	formId: {{ widget_data.myForm.form_to_use }},
	redirectURL: '<https://www.google.com>'
	// Other parameters being set, including email follow ups, or, inline thank you messages...
	onFormSubmit:function(e){
        return false;
        e.preventDefault();
    }
})  

```
I’m having similar problems (adding a link in the WYSIWYG for a blog)
Has anyone done A/B testing in concert with Hotjar?
Q: if you have a `require_js` in block form in a module that gets loaded multiple times, does it get added to the footer for each instance of the module or?
Should only add it once
awesome, similar but not holding my breath, how about if you have multiple different modules but the require_js code block is exactly the same?
<@U7AU6414J> this is awesome! Thank you :raised_hands::skin-tone-2:
Basically we hold onto all the required assets until the end keeping them unique by string and only then put them on the page, so you should only end up with one copy of every asset.
awesome, thank you Matt, honestly didn’t expect that to work that way with the block form of require_js would only have expected that with just a straight require_js of a file.
*are <http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com> sites supposed to be minified/combined?* looking into performance optimizations for someone who has a HS theme pack, noticed his css isn’t minified or combined
